articles.title: At least 1 in 10 women experience miscarriage: Study, Europe News & Top Stories - The Straits Times
articles.description: Levels of care for women suffering miscarriage is also highly uneven across countries, and even within many wealthy nations.. Read more at straitstimes.com.
articles.content:
PARIS (AFP) - One in seven pregnancies worldwide ends in miscarriage, and eleven per cent of women endure a failed pregnancy at least once in their lifetime, experts said Tuesday (April 27).

articles.title: US tourists set to be welcomed back into Europe soon - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: More than 15 million Americans a year visited Europe before the crisis.
articles.content:
American tourists could soon be visiting continental Europe again, more than a year after the European Union restricted travel to the 27-nation bloc to a bare minimum to contain the coronavirus.

articles.title: India seeks remdesivir, oxygen from EU, aid expected soon - EU official - The Star Online
articles.description: BRUSSELS (Reuters) -     India has asked the European Union to send medical oxygen and Gilead's antiviral drug remdesivir to fight a surge in COVID-19 cases, an EU official said on Monday, adding that the aid could be made available soon.
